page.title: 08Wright's Flour MIll 2
page.content: At the turn of the century all the millstones except those used to make Imperial Wholemeal Flour were taken out and a continental roller system was installed.In 1909 the water power which had always been used was stopped and electricity was then used.During the 2nd World War the mill was constantly under threat of bombing,as it was on the edge of London.Nowadays 550 boxes are packed in one hour.The mill now is much more efficient,two new plants are capable of producing three tonnes of flour per hour.The mill has a storage capacity of 2500 tonnes of wheat and a 475 tonne bulk storage plant for the finished products.The mill also has its own laboratories and bakery which tests the flour to make sure it is of the finest quality for making bread.
